skill.name: drugbank-database
skill.description: Access and analyze comprehensive drug information from the DrugBank database including drug properties, interactions, targets, pathways, chemical structures, and pharmacology data. This skill should be used when working with pharmaceutical data, drug discovery research, pharmacology studies, drug-drug interaction analysis, target identification, chemical similarity searches, ADMET predictions, or any task requiring detailed drug and drug target information from DrugBank.

security_audit.summary: No credential harvesting, exfiltration, or malicious execution patterns were found. Network usage is limited to documented DrugBank API examples. The code focuses on local XML parsing and drug data queries.

content.user_title: Analyze DrugBank data for drug research
content.value_statement: Drug research often needs structured access to DrugBank without manual parsing. This skill guides safe downloads and helps you query drugs, interactions, targets, and properties quickly.
actual_capabilities: Download DrugBank XML data with drugbank-downloader and open parsed roots.
Retrieve drug details by DrugBank ID with name, type, description, and indication.
List drug-drug interactions with partner IDs, names, and descriptions.
Extract drug targets with actions, organisms, and UniProt IDs.
Get calculated and experimental chemical properties and structures.
Search drugs by name with exact or partial match.
limitations: Requires a DrugBank account and license acceptance.
Needs local DrugBank XML data or an API key for REST examples.
Large XML files can be slow or memory heavy.
Advanced analytics rely on external libraries and example code.

use_cases.description: Compile identifiers, indications, targets, and interactions for a candidate compound.

use_cases.title: Check polypharmacy risk
use_cases.description: Review known DrugBank interactions for a medication list.

use_cases.title: Create a searchable dataset
use_cases.description: Parse DrugBank XML and export structured tables for downstream analysis.

prompt_templates.title: Fetch drug summary
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the skill to load DrugBank data and return name, type, indication, and mechanism of action for DB00001.

prompt_templates.title: Find interactions
prompt_templates.scenario: You need DDI details for one drug
prompt_templates.prompt: List all interactions for DB00001 with partner IDs and short descriptions. Summarize the total count.

prompt_templates.title: Compare target sets
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare targets for DB00001 and DB00002. Report shared targets and key action types.

prompt_templates.title: Export a dataset
prompt_templates.scenario: You are preparing a research table
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline steps and example code to parse DrugBank XML into a table with IDs, names, targets count, and interaction count.

output_examples.input: Show key details and interactions for DB00001
output: Drug: Lepirudin, biotech drug with thrombin inhibition indication
Interactions: 42 total, including Warfarin and Aspirin with increased bleeding risk
Targets: Thrombin (F2) with known action yes

best_practices: Specify the DrugBank version used for reproducibility.
Cache parsed data to avoid repeated XML processing.
Validate chemical structures before downstream modeling.
anti_patterns: Treating interaction descriptions as clinical advice.
Using undocumented API endpoints or scraping pages.

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude and Codex?
faq.answer: Yes. It is plain Python guidance and works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the data limits?
faq.answer: Access depends on your DrugBank license and API plan limits.

faq.question: Can I integrate with pandas or RDKit?
faq.answer: Yes. The examples show pandas usage and reference RDKit for chemistry.

faq.question: Does it send my credentials anywhere?
faq.answer: No. It only shows local configuration and optional DrugBank API calls.

faq.question: What if downloads fail?
faq.answer: Check credentials, disk space, and try an older DrugBank version.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic XML parsers?
faq.answer: It provides DrugBank specific queries and ready examples for drug data.
